lines.text: What if... Slick killed him without firing his gun, first?
Huh?
Like, maybe he had a crossbow that burnt up in the fire, or something. Or threw something sharp really fast.
Well, we didn't find any sort of murder weapon like that...
How about an icicle! The classic murder mystery trick! Disappearing murder weapon!
Where would he get an icicle from? And why would he use that instead of the gun?
Maybe not an icicle...
A candle! One of the melted candles! Sharpened to a point!
Sharpened to a- are you listenin' to yourself?
It's red, so it'd hide the blood...
If- I can't believe I'm entertainin' this enough to argue against it, but if he threw a sharpened candle...
How come it ended up with the rest of 'em, not in the guy's chest?
...It didn't! In fact... that candle is still on the <c=#FF6000>Go Wizard's</c> body!
Huh?!
When he got impaled, he tried to pull out the candle- and the pointy part broke off in the wound!
Leaving him holding a candle stub, and leaving the wax to melt!
Wait, you're sayin'... that candle he's holdin' is the candle that was used to stab him?
Yep!
And that he had time to sharpen a candle, and throw it with deadly force?
Instead of usin' the gun that he had?
Uh.
And- and, if there were melted wax in the wound, we'd know...
And f-for that matter, the- it- the candle melted in the wound but not in his hand? I- d-don't think so.
Look, it was a good idea, okay?!
It was... an average idea.
For you.
Which means it was a bad idea.
Maaaaaaaaan, can't I get a little respect?
